attributes.action: To alleviate over-crowding on trains, abolish 1st class travel at peak times
attributes.background: Overcrowding is particularly bad on commuter trains during peak hours. To increase network capacity, at a low cost, standard class passengers should be permitted to travel free in first class during designated hours. The government should legislate to ensure all Train Operating companies comply.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is an operational decision for train operating companies.

You could start a new petition for this to be included as a requirement in all rail franchise agreements with the Department for Transport.
